content.description: This route climbs thru the over hanging left side of the south face. There is a ponderosa pine just left of the route that the name is derived from.
content.location: Left side of the south face just right of the pine tree.

content.description: Lieback up and a little left on the obvious over hanging rib-rail feature left of center on the south face. Nice large jugs appear above the rib for the top out.
content.location: Located just to the right of Sap Sucker left of center on the south face.

content.description: Start out on the distinctive sharp holds on the Murray Route. Climb the direct line using small holds. This route climbs the Murray Route in static style.
content.location: Located right of center on the over hanging yellow rock just right of center on the south face.

content.description: To my knowledge this route has never been repeated using Murray's sequence. A large dynamic move is made by starting with your hands on the two best holds and throws to the the largest hold in the middle of the route. The right foot hold Murray used has since broken. To line up for the dyno Bob kept his left foot under him and posted the right foot on a high crystal out right (right aligned lieback to throw from). Stactic moves finish up the route. The route climbs the wall using the direct line.
content.location: Located in the over hanging yellow rock just right center on the south face.

content.description: Start out on the Murray Route and diagonal up and left onto some interesting crystals. with The Murray Route starts on some over hanging yellow rock on some distinctive sharp holds.
content.location: Located just right of center on the south face. Just right of the Jeff Lawler Route.

content.description: Pull up and press out one of the most classic mantle moves in the Black Hills. A veritable flounder-fest for all.
content.location: Located on the very over hanging east face.

content.description: This over hanging route has some very distinctive jugs to pull on. The start has gotten harder due to footholds breaking. Very cool moves... An all time Iron Mt. classic.
content.location: Located about four feet right of the Murray Route on the south face.

content.description: This route is very tricky featuring more moves than it seems like it should take to top out. Very thin and quite steep. The start is quite under cut.
content.location: Located  on the southeast corner of the Test Piece about five feet right of Jury of Peers and to the left of Mikey's Mantle.

content.description: Start out on the Rib Route but move up and right into an over hanging groove. Follow the groove to the top.
content.location: Located on the south face just right of the Rib Route.

content.description: Be prepared to throw big on this route. Start on a big hold and toss to the summit jugs. Go big or go home!
content.location: Located on the northwest corner of the Test Piece just around the corner from Sap Sucker.

content.description: Party Trick problem. Start on Judges and immediately throw your right hand up to the decent hold. Transition your body up onto the horrible sloper holds and stick your feet however you can and TRUST them. 50/50 on weather or not they fail you. If you can smear slowly push your body up to the next hold which will get you standing. Finish out on decent holds to the top on low angle.  Little more traffic could clean up better.
content.location: Start on Judges Chambers and move directly up kind of a party trick problem. Fun non the less.

content.description: A very beautiful boulder that pretty much overhangs on all sides. Routes range from V0- to V8. The landings aren't bad either.
